title: Pre-flight checks for session initialization
summary: Added startup checklist to session-init.sh that checks for hanging work before creating new session
detail: Implemented comprehensive pre-flight checks in session-init.sh that verify clean state before starting new session. Checks for: (1) Current session branch not ended, (2) Uncommitted changes, (3) Stale merged branches, (4) Unmerged session branches with work. Interactive when TTY available, auto-cleanup in non-interactive mode. User requested this to ensure clean slate when starting Claude in a service. Adds 125 lines but significantly improves UX by preventing 'forgotten work' syndrome.
learned: Users want proactive cleanup checks at session start
Interactive prompts should gracefully degrade to auto-cleanup in non-interactive contexts
Show what needs attention rather than silently creating nested sessions
